meanings.definition: Present participle of overture: to present or introduce something for consideration or discussion.
meanings.sent1: She overtured her idea to the team during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always overtured his suggestions in a clear manner.
meanings.sent3: The cat overtured its new toy to the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun overtured its rays over the horizon, welcoming a new day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overtured the exciting field trip to the students.

meanings.definition: Past tense of overture: to make a proposal or offer.
meanings.sent1: They overtured a compromise to end the dispute.
meanings.sent2: She overtured her assistance when they needed help.
meanings.sent3: The magician overtured a trick that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The chef overtured a new dish that became a customer favorite.
meanings.sent5: He overtured his support for the charity event.

meanings.definition: Past participle of overture: having made a proposal or offer.
meanings.sent1: The overtured agreement was finally accepted by both parties.
meanings.sent2: She was pleased with the overtured response to her invitation.
meanings.sent3: The overtured gift brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The overtured plan led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent5: His overtured proposal was well-received by the committee.
